headline: Best Buy Clocks Highest Comp Sales Growth In 3 Years, Holds On To Annual Forecast Despite Tariff Uncertainty
summary: Best Buy Co Inc (NYSE:BBY) reported second-quarter 2026 adjusted earnings of $1.28 per share on Thursday, beating the consensus of $1.21. headline: A solid quarter at Best Buy overshadowed by outlook grown cloudy with tariffs
summary: Best Buy posted a solid second quarter that exceeded Wall Street expectations, but that was overshadowed by an outlook that has grown cloudy due to massive tariffs the U.S. is imposing on imported goods.  The Richfield, Minnesota, company cited the potential impact of tariffs on its business and customers.  In Best Buy's most recent quarter, comparable sales, used as a barometer of a retailer's health, increased 1.6% with Wall Street expecting a slight decline.

content.title: A solid quarter at Best Buy overshadowed by outlook grown cloudy with tariffs
content.summary: Best Buy posted a solid second quarter that exceeded Wall Street expectations, but that was overshadowed by an outlook that has grown cloudy due to massive tariffs the U.S. is imposing on imported goods.  The Richfield, Minnesota, company cited the potential impact of tariffs on its business and customers.  In Best Buy's most recent quarter, comparable sales, used as a barometer of a retailer's health, increased 1.6% with Wall Street expecting a slight decline.

headline: Best Buy Stock Falls After Earnings Beat. Why Wall Street’s Disappointed.
summary: Best Buy’s  fiscal second quarter topped Wall Street’s expectations on nearly all fronts, with the electronics retailer notching its strongest same-store sales growth in years.  For the quarter ended Aug. 2, Best Buy reported adjusted earnings of $1.28 a share on $9.44 billion in revenue.  “This better-than-expected sales growth was driven by a mix of new technology innovation, our relentless focus on a seamless omni-channel customer experience and our strong vendor partnerships,” she added.

content.title: Best Buy Stock Falls After Earnings Beat. Why Wall Street’s Disappointed.
content.summary: Best Buy’s  fiscal second quarter topped Wall Street’s expectations on nearly all fronts, with the electronics retailer notching its strongest same-store sales growth in years.  For the quarter ended Aug. 2, Best Buy reported adjusted earnings of $1.28 a share on $9.44 billion in revenue.  “This better-than-expected sales growth was driven by a mix of new technology innovation, our relentless focus on a seamless omni-channel customer experience and our strong vendor partnerships,” she added.

headline: Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) Beats Q2 Sales Expectations
summary: Electronics retailer Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) reported Q2 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 1.6% year on year to $9.44 billion. The company expects the full year’s revenue to be around $41.5 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.28 per share was 4.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) Beats Q2 Sales Expectations
content.summary: Electronics retailer Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) reported Q2 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 1.6% year on year to $9.44 billion. The company expects the full year’s revenue to be around $41.5 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.28 per share was 4.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Best Buy maintains annual forecast on tariff worries; shares fall
summary: (Reuters) -Best Buy stuck to its annual sales and profit forecasts on Thursday despite posting quarterly results that topped estimates, as it expects tariff-induced uncertainty in the second half of the year.  Shares of the top U.S. electronics retailer fell 5.7% in morning trading, as investors focused on a likely hit to the company's margins due to higher tariffs on U.S. imports.  Several retailers, including Best Buy, have had to raise prices on some goods to absorb the hit from these steep levies.

content.title: Best Buy maintains annual forecast on tariff worries; shares fall
content.summary: (Reuters) -Best Buy stuck to its annual sales and profit forecasts on Thursday despite posting quarterly results that topped estimates, as it expects tariff-induced uncertainty in the second half of the year.  Shares of the top U.S. electronics retailer fell 5.7% in morning trading, as investors focused on a likely hit to the company's margins due to higher tariffs on U.S. imports.  Several retailers, including Best Buy, have had to raise prices on some goods to absorb the hit from these steep levies.

thumbnail.caption: A person enters a Best Buy store in Manhattan, New York City

headline: Best Buy: Fiscal Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.22 per share. The consumer electronics retailer posted revenue of $9.44 billion in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Ten analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $9.2 billion.

content.title: Best Buy: Fiscal Q2 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.22 per share. The consumer electronics retailer posted revenue of $9.44 billion in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Ten analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $9.2 billion.

headline: Best Buy Reports Second Quarter Results
summary: MINNEAPOLIS, August 28, 2025--Best Buy Co., Inc. (NYSE: BBY) today announced results for the 13-week second quarter ended August 2, 2025 ("Q2 FY26"), as compared to the 13-week second quarter ended August 3, 2024 ("Q2 FY25").

content.title: Best Buy Reports Second Quarter Results
content.summary: MINNEAPOLIS, August 28, 2025--Best Buy Co., Inc. (NYSE: BBY) today announced results for the 13-week second quarter ended August 2, 2025 ("Q2 FY26"), as compared to the 13-week second quarter ended August 3, 2024 ("Q2 FY25").

headline: Alibaba Earnings, Inflation Data, GDP Estimate: Still to Come This Week
